DataElement.preferredName: Diagnosis Biopsy Histology Finding Basis Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the site(s) of the biopsy that the diagnosis was based on.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease._The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.:Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.:Basis; the fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provides the foundation for something.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.
The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: ..11/8/12mn-Concept definition change in NCIt for 'Finding C3376' Was: Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom). Now: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease. no version change needed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Specify the biopsy site used
ReferenceDocuments.description: Specify the biopsy site used to indicate the diagnostic evidence:

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping for CDE:2787385
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedObservationResult > TargetAnatomicSite.code WHERE PerformedObservationResult > AssessedResultRelationship > PerformedObservation > PerformedDiagnosis.value = "GVHD" AND PerformedDiagnosis.diseaseStatusCode = "Acute" AND AssessedResultRelationship.typeCode = "ConfirmatoryTests"

DataElement.changeDescription: ..11/8/12mn-Concept definition change in NCIt for 'Finding C3376' Was: Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom). Now: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease. no version change needed. .1/9/14mn-added Bridg info. System generated def displayed as alt def. AK 6/12/15
